timeline.message: DB-10460 fix default value for bit data type in show_create_table statement

timeline.bodyHTML:
this is necessary since we are putting that generated DDL string into this

StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder("SELECT * FROM (VALUES '");
sb.append(DDL);
String extStr = extTblString.toString();
if (extStr.length() > 0)
	sb.append(extStr);
sb.append(";') FOO (DDL)");
resultSet[0] = executeStatement(sb);

and therefore all quotes like ' have to be escaped, resulting in double quotes ‘'. For X’000' this means X''000''.

This scheme of creating a `”SELECT * FROM (VALUES ‘“ + result + “;) FOO(col1, col2)’ is used in all of SpliceAdmin.java, might be up for some more surprises.

Actually maybe simple would have been to solve escaping generally here by using sth like

String escapeAsValue(String val) {
  return val.replaceAll("'", "''"); 
}

and then use everywhere sth like ”SELECT * FROM (VALUES ‘“ + doEscaping(result) + “;) FOO(col1, col2)”;
timeline.author: martinrupp
